info.title: WIEDPUG API
info.description: API Documentation for the WIEDPUG Network

post.summary: Transmit new Auction Catalogues and Private Catalogues
post.description: Used by brokers to transmit Original broadcast and private auction catalogue data to the Network for auctions regulated by the Australian Wool Exchange Limited.

post.summary: Request for Data relating to Auction Catalogue, Private Catalogue and Auction Catalogue Updates
post.description: Used by brokers to request Private and Broadcast data, as well as Re-requesting data for Auction Catalogues, Private Catalogues, and Auction Catalogue Updates

isSuccessful.description: Indicator if the request has been successfully processed.

message.description: Contains information about the response if applicable.

data.description: Contains response data. e.g. Auction Catalogue

ApiResult.description: A standard API response object used for all successful API responses

CalculationBasis.description:
This is used to identify the method used to calculate the post sale charge. The post sale charge may be a per bale, per kilogram or percentage of the price of the wool. Calculation Basis is always per bale in Australia.
B: Post sale charge is levied per bale
K: The post sale charge is a charge per kil
P: The post sale charge is a % of first cost

CalibrationFlag.description:
O: The values for Colour X, Y, Z and Y-Z have been measured by an instrument calibrated to reference wool, based on illuminant C and 2º observer angle. Old calibration has been deactivated as at 1st January 2001.
N: The values for Colour X, Y, Z and Y-Z have been measured by an instrument calibrated to certified tiles, based on illuminant D65 and 10º observer angle, and corrected for any glass effects

isSuccessful.description: Indicator if the request has been successfully processed.

message.description: Contains information about the response if applicable.

data.description: Contains response data. e.g. Auction Catalogue

CatalogueListApiResult.description: A standard API response object used for all successful API responses

CatalogueSection.description:
These are the codes allocated by the local wool authorities to sectionalise the sale catalogues.
BLK: ODDS - Black
DEAD: ODDS - Dead
FLC: MFLC - Merino Fleece
FMG: ODDS - Fellmongered
ODD: ODDS - Oddments
SKIN: ODDS - Skin Wool
SKT: MSKT - Skirting
TRAD: MFLC / MSKT / XBFS / ODDS - Traditionally Shown
XBD: C XBFS - Crossbred (Flc & Skt)

CatalogueSymbol.description:
These are the symbols defined in the AWEX Wool Selling Rules. If this field has no value, it will indicate that there are no catalogue symbols for that lotTo obtain the current code list of values that may be used in this field please go to this URL: http://www.awex.com.au/standards/catalogue
A: Dumped Bales
C: Charity/Good Cause
D: De-banded
G: Lot offered under Trial Selling Status
H: Classed Samples (bearing Classing House stencil)
M: Machine processed (Decotted, crushed or blended)
O: Fellmongered
R: Reconditioned from wet
S: Wool is unclassed
T: Tested (where Test House is not AWTA)
U: Unskirted or Not Skirted to Code of Practice requirements
W: Broker (Re)classed (Classing House stencil - P cert. only)
X: Contains Broker Inspected (Classing House stencil - I cert. only)
Y: Pigmented and/or Medullated Fibre Risk (Run with or Black section)

baleIdentifications.description: This field is completely optional when sending Auction Catalogue Updates

interlotComponentBales.description: This field is completely optional when sending Auction Catalogue Updates

CertificateIDPrefix.description:
2: Sydney Laboratory
3: Melbourne Laboratory
6: Fremantle Laboratory

CertificateIDSuffix.description:
B: Bulk Class
C: Colour
D: PTC (Pre-Sale Test Certificate – Other Grower Lot)
F: Premium Test
I: Subjectively Appraised Interlot
J: Combination - Yield & Micron, Length & Strength, Colour
L: Length & Strength
M: Objectively Matched Lot
N: Objectively matched Interlot
Q: Bulk Class – Quality Managed
P: PTC (Pre-sale Test Certificate - Classed Grower Lot)
R: Guidance Report
W: Scoured Wool
Y: Post sale Core Test

dateIssued.description: Date value in ISO 8601 standard UTC date format. e.g. 2024-03-21
Date value in ISO 8601 standard UTC date format. e.g. 2024-03-21

cleanWeight1.description: Clean weight = Net Weight X Yield

cleanWeight2.description: Clean weight = Net Weight X Yield

cleanWeight3.description: Clean weight = Net Weight X Yield

cleanWeight4.description: Clean weight = Net Weight X Yield

cleanWeight5.description: Clean weight = Net Weight X Yield

factorAirflowMean.description: Factor for Airflow Mean. Factor used in combination calculation.

CombinationFlag.description:
This field indicates the following: If an Australian Securities Exchange combination was requested and the combination satisfies the contract parameters of ASX the appropriate flag will be transmitted.
N. Normal Combination
S. ASX24 Combination (formerly SFE)
4. ASX19.5 54W Combination
5. ASX21.0 55W Combination
6. ASX22.6 56W Combination
7. ASX19.5 54W, ASX21.0 55W and ASX22.6 56W Combination
8. ASX19.5 54W and ASX21.0 55W Combination
9: ASX21.0 55W and ASX22.6 56W Combination
A. ICAP Wool Contract - China Type 54P
B. ICAP Wool Contract - China Type 54
C. ICAP Wool Contract - China Type 55
D. ICAP Wool Contract - China Type 56
E. ICAP Wool Contract - China Type 424
F. ICAP Wool Contract - China Type Standard

CountryCode.description:
A code for the country in which the transmission was created. Country Code using ISO 3166-1 standard
AU: Australia
NZ: New Zealand
FR: France
ZA: South Africa

type.description:
A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.
This specification encourages that, when dereferenced, it provide human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028]). 
When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".      
e.g. For 400 Bad Request, the "type" value can be "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc9110#section-15.5.1"

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. 
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization(e.g., using proactive content negotiation; see[RFC7231], Section 3.4).
e.g. "One or more validation errors occurred."

status.description: The HTTP status code ([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. e.g. 400, 403, etc.

errors.description: Dictionary of errors in <PropertyName, ErrorDetails[]> format. e.g. errors: { "name": ["Product name is required"], "category": ["Category name cannot be longer than 20 characters."]  }

CustomProblemDetails.description: A machine-readable format for specifying errors in HTTP API responses based on https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807.

DarkAndMedullatedFibreRisk.description:
E: Error in Processing
N: Not Applicable
D: Not Declared
1: Risk Level 1 (lowest)
2: Risk Level 2
3: Risk Level 3
4: Risk Level 4
5: Risk Level 5
6: Risk Level 6

DeliveryBasis.description:
D: Delivery Nominated Destination
L: Loaded on Transport

fibresMeasuredPercentage.description: Percentage of fibres measured for the measurement.

comfortFactorPercentage.description: Percentage of Fibres 30 Microns and under.

coreTestSamplingDate.description:
For records 31 and 55 this is the date core test was sampled or date combination/OML was requested.
For the 21A record this is the date the core test was sampled, the last date of weighing for untested wool or the date the Combination/OML was requested.        
Date value in ISO 8601 standard UTC date format. e.g. 2024-03-21.

dateIssued.description: Date value in ISO 8601 standard UTC format. e.g. 2024-03-21.

Laboratory.description:
The code for a Test House.
1: Australian Wool Testing Authority
2: N.Z. Wool Testing Authority
3: N.Z. Wool Testing Service
4: South African Wool Testing Authority

regrabSampleWeight.description: The weight of a regrab sample, a grab sample taken after the wool has been initially sampled and tested, is shown on the new certificate

stapleLength.description: The mean length of a staple from tip to base. At least 60 staples are measured for each test lot.

stapleLengthCvPercentage.description: Staple length coefficient of variation. This is a measurement of the staple length variability and is reported as a percentage.

stapleStrength.description:
The force required to break a staple of given thickness. 
The average strength is expressed in Newtons per kilotex.Individual staples range in strength from 0 to 100 Newtons per kilotex

stapleLengthMinimum.description:
The mean length of a staple from tip to base. At least 60 staples are measured for each test lot. 
Minimum - the lowest value in a range of staple length values.

stapleLengthMaximum.description:
The mean length of a staple from tip to base. At least 60 staples are measured for each test lot. 
Maximum - the highest value in a range of staple length values.

stapleStrengthMinimum.description:
The force required to break a staple of given thickness. 
The average strength is expressed in Newtons per kilotex.Individual staples range in strength from 0 to 100 Newtons per kilotex
Minimum - The lowest value in a range of staple strength values

stapleStrengthMaximum.description:
The force required to break a staple of given thickness. 
The average strength is expressed in Newtons per kilotex.Individual staples range in strength from 0 to 100 Newtons per kilotex
Maximum - The highest value in a range of staple strength value

positionOfBreakPercentageTip.description:
The position of break indicates the location of the weakest part of the staple.
Tip - Percentage of wool staple with a tip section position of break.

positionOfBreakPercentageMiddle.description:
The position of break indicates the location of the weakest part of the staple. 
Middle - Percentage of wool staples with a middle section position of break.

positionOfBreakPercentageBase.description:
The position of break indicates the location of the weakest part of the staple. 
Base - Percentage of wool staples with a base section position of break.

team3Hauteur.description:
Predicted Fibre Length in the Top. NOTE: Any certificate issued (or reissued with a new Certificate ID Number) from 1st July, 2006 will be based on the TEAM-3 calculations. 
Anything issued prior to 1st July, 2006 will be based on the TEAM-2 calculations.
A check against the Date Issued field in the 51L or 51K record will determine which TEAM formula has been used.

isLsSampleSecured.description:
Specifies whether the L/S sample is secured or not.
`true` for a secured L/S sample
`false` for a unsecured L/S sample

expectedBarbe.description:
Expected Barbe length in the Top. Used for NZ Crossbred wool certificates based on the 2016 calculation. 
Any Length and Strength certificate for NZ Crossbred wool will include a calculated Barbe value based on the 2016 calculation.

team3HauteurCvPercentage.description: Coefficient of Variation of Hauteur. NOTE: Refer to note in `Team3Hauteur`.

team3RomainePercentage.description: Romaine. NOTE: Refer to note in `Team3Hauteur`.

dateIssued.description: Date value in ISO 8601 standard. e.g. 2024-03-21

stapleStrengthLowest25Percent.description: Average Staple Strength of the lowest 25% of staples measured for Strength.

stapleLength.description: The mean length of a staple from tip to base. At least 60 staples are measured for each test lot.

stapleLengthCvPercentage.description: Staple length coefficient of variation. This is a measurement of the staple length variability and is reported as a percentage.

stapleStrength.description:
The force required to break a staple of given thickness. 
The average strength is expressed in Newtons per kilotex.Individual staples range in strength from 0 to 100 Newtons per kilotex

positionOfBreakPercentageTip.description:
The position of break indicates the location of the weakest part of the staple.
Tip - Percentage of wool staple with a tip section position of break.

positionOfBreakPercentageMiddle.description:
The position of break indicates the location of the weakest part of the staple. 
Middle - Percentage of wool staples with a middle section position of break.

positionOfBreakPercentageBase.description:
The position of break indicates the location of the weakest part of the staple. 
Base - Percentage of wool staples with a base section position of break.

team3Hauteur.description:
Predicted Fibre Length in the Top. NOTE: Any certificate issued (or reissued with a new Certificate ID Number) from 1st July, 2006 will be based on the TEAM-3 calculations. 
Anything issued prior to 1st July, 2006 will be based on the TEAM-2 calculations.
A check against the Date Issued field in the 51L or 51K record will determine which TEAM formula has been used.

isLsSampleSecured.description:
Specifies whether the L/S sample is secured or not.
true: for a secured L/S sample
flase: for a unsecured L/S sample

expectedBarbe.description:
Expected Barbe length in the Top. Used for NZ Crossbred wool certificates based on the 2016 calculation. 
Any Length and Strength certificate for NZ Crossbred wool will include a calculated Barbe value based on the 2016 calculation.

team3HauteurCvPercentage.description: Coefficient of Variation of Hauteur. NOTE: Refer to note in `Team3Hauteur`.

team3RomainePercentage.description: Romaine. NOTE: Refer to note in `Team3Hauteur`.

dateIssued.description: Date in ISO 8601 standard UTC date format. e.g. 2024-03-21

stapleStrengthLowest25Percent.description: Average Staple Strength of the lowest 25% of staples measured for Strength.

isNoLot.description:
A flag used to indicate whether or not the lot is included for sale in the auction.
It is used in New Zealand only.
`true` = Normal Lot, `false` = No Lot

lightestIndividualBaleWeight.description: This is the Reweigh Gross Kg of the lightest bale in the lot.

firstOfferLotIdentity.description:
This is a compound name for lot number and lot suffix, where the lot number is 5 number characters and the lot suffix is 1 alphanumeric character.
The suffix is used when a lot is broken up but the original lot number is retained; for example, if 2 bales of a 10-bale lot got wet and the 8 bales the 2 bales are offered separately, one could have a suffix A and the other a suffix B. 
Where a suffix is not used, the lot number occupies the whole of the Lot Identity field.

awexId.description: AWEX-ID must conform to the current AWEX-ID code standard.

appraiserId.description: Contains the AWEX accredited appraiser ID for this lot.

classersRegisteredNumber.description: The AWEX stencil number of the classer or classing house responsible for the final classification of the wool before sale.

awexIdComment.description: This field provides for additional comments relating to the information contained in the `awexId` field.

awexIdAuditCode.description: Audit code used for verifying if `awexId` was issued by AWEX

coreTestSamplingDate.description:
Date value in ISO 8601 standard UTC date format. e.g. 2024-03-21.
For records 31 and 55 this is the date core test was sampled or date combination/OML was requested. 
For the 21A record this is the date the core test was sampled, the last date of weighing for untested wool or the date the Combination/OML was requested.

woolDescriptionComment.description: This field provides for additional comments relating to the information contained in the Wool Description field.

woolDescription.description:
This field contains a description that is either an AWEX-ID description or another appraisal description.
Alternative valid appraisal descriptions include AWC type, Exporter type. 
The AWEX-ID description must conform to the current AWEX-ID code standard.
If sending an AWC type, the first character of this field must be set to `W`, followed by the AWC Type, for all other non AWEX-ID typing descriptions the first character should be set to `P` followed by the type.If sending AWEX-ID the type starts from position one of the field (i.e.there are no leading characters). 
This field is to be always transmitted in upper case.

gstTaxInvoiceFlag.description: `true` = GST amount is applicable to invoice. `false` = GST amount is not applicable to invoice.

woolDescriptionAuditCode.description: Audit code used for verifying if AWEX-ID was issued by AWEX.

numberOfOverweightBales.description: This is the total number of bales with a Reweigh Gross Kg over 204kg.

offerDate.description: Date value in ISO 8601 standard UTC date format. e.g. 2024-03-21

LotType.description:
A code used to describe wool lot preparation. It is not wool type. `*` wool meets clip preparation guidelines.`#` wool does not necessarily meet clip preparation guidelines
1: (Suffix - P) Classed Grower Lot *
2: (Suffix - M) Objectively Matched Lot
3: (Suffix - J) Combined Certificate
4: (Suffix - I) Subjectively Matched Interlot
5: (Suffix - B) Other Bulk Class Lot #
6: Not Used
7: (Suffix - N) Objectively Matched Interlot
8: (Suffix - Q) Classed Bulk Class Lot – Quality Managed *
9: (Suffix - D) Other Grower Lot #

LsCertType.description:
0: Length & Strength tested
1: Length only test requested
2: Insufficient staples

MulesingStatus.description:
NM: Non Mulesed
LN: Liquid Nitrogen
CM: Ceased Mulesing
AA: Mulesed with Analgesic &/or Anaesthetic
M: Mulesed
ND: Not Declared

OfferType.description:
P: Previous/Passed-In Price
N: Negotiable Price
R: Reserve Price

PackCondition.description:
Where a line/lot contains a Pack with a lower condition, the lower condition shall apply. The hierarchy from highest to lowest is N, M, R, X. This field is optional in New Zealand transmissions.
N: New Pack (not previously used)
M: Marked (not previously cored and grabbed
R: Repaired (previously core and/or grabbed and repaired)
X: Not repaired (previously cored and/or grabbed) (excl reoffer

PackMaterial.description:
Where a line/lot contains a Pack with a lower Material, the lower Material shall apply.The hierarchy from highest to lowest is N, E, J, K. Printed catalogue condition: The code for Nylon packs shall not be printed (but shall be transmitted).
N: Nylon Packs (complete lots only)
E: Experimental Packs
J: Jute packs (complete lots or lots that contain portions of Nylon and/or HDPE 5 and/or HDPE 1 and Jute packs)
K: HDPE1 packs (complete lots or lots that contain portions of Nylon and/or HDPE 5 and HDPE 1 packs)

PackType.description:
A code used to indicate how the wool has been baled. The most common type is Farm bales. Original - the pack type when the wool was originally baled. Preferred - The pack type which the buyer would prefer to be used when his wool is dumped.
0: Standard (farm) bale
1: Bag/butt
2: Lightweight bale
3: Jumbo bale
4: Single bales (normal density dumped)
5: Single bales (high density dumped)
6: Single bales (super high density dumped)
7: 3 bale tripack (super high density dumped)
8: 2 bale tripack (super high density dumped)
9: U bales
A: 4 or 6 bale unitised (normal density dumped)
B: 4 or 6 bale unitised (high density dumped)
C: 4 or 6 bale unitised (super high density dumped)
D: Two Bale Module (2BM)
E: J9 size bale used for scoured wool
F: J12 size bale used for scoured wool
Z: Mixed (to be used with groups only, that is, record type 12)

PriceBasis.description:
G: Greasy
C: CLCOF (ACOF or NZCOF)
I: CIF
F: FOB

QualityScheme.description:
The registered four character or less quality scheme code: To obtain the current code list please go to this URL: http://www.awex.com.au/standards/catalogue/
ASWG: Australian Superfine Woolgrower Association (Member)
AUTH: Authentico
BETC: Better Choices (Pain Mitigation)
BIOC: BioClip (Biologically Harvested)
DAL3: Dalcare-3
EUEC: EU Eco label (meets EU Eco standards)
MTEC: Merino Tech WA
ACO: Organic - Australian Certified Organic
DBAA: Organic - Demeter Biodynamic Agriculture Aust.
USA: Organic - Meets USA Certification requirements
NASA: Organic - National Association for Sustainable Agriculture Aust.
SXC: Organic - Southern Cross Certified
RWS: Responsible Wool Standard
SBFC: Schute Bell Fibre Care
SW: SustainaWOOL
SWAU: SustainaWOOL Gold
TQMS: Traprock QMS/TIMS
FAP: Farm Assurance Program
PWIA: PGG Wrightson Integrity Assured
FERN: Woolcare Fernmark

qualitySchemeRegistrationId.description: Registered Identification issued by the relevant Accreditation or Membership organisation.

qualitySchemeOtherDetail.description: Used to transmit (other) information relevant to the Scheme that is required by the buyer(e.g.Month/Year shorn).

ReissueChargeFlag.description:
0: Original certificate charge
1: Re-issued no charge
2: Re-issued with additional Charge
3: Re-issued with replacement charge (credit issued against original certificate)

ReportingFlag.description:
R: Report, results for this test are supplied for information only
C: Certificate results for this test are certified
U: This lot is untested and there are no certificate results

saleDateRequested.description: Date value in ISO 8601 standard UTC date format. e.g. 2024-03-21

startDateTimeStatusRequest.description: Date and Time value in ISO 8601 standard UTC datetime. e.g. 2024-03-21T19:25:04Z

endDateTimeStatusRequest.description: Date and Time with offset value in ISO 8601 standard. e.g. 2024-03-21T19:25:04+00:00

excludedTypes.description: Record types and record sub-types to be excluded. e.g. 20 - Lot Header, 22A - Group Header.

SaleType.description:
A: Auction (open cry)
T: Tender
O: Offer
AV: Availability
E: Electronic Sale

SoftwareCompany.description:
1: Talman
2: Symbotic
3: Jumbuck/Datacon
4: Jemalong
5: NA - no value
6: Modiano
7: AWH
6: AWTA

SourceCode.description:
Source of the lot presented for sale.
1: Grower
2: Dealer
3: BulkClass

SubTypeToBeExcluded.description:
A: First record of one type
B: Second record of that type
C: Colour Certificate record
D: Detail record
E: Scoured Yield Extension
F: Premium Certificate record
H: Header record
I: Subjective Interlot Certificate record
J: Combination Certificate record
K: Length and Strength Combination Certificate record

N: Objectively Matched Interlot Certificate Record

regrabSampleWeight.description: The weight of a regrab sample, a grab sample taken after the wool has been initially sampled and tested, is shown on the new certificate.

woolBase.description:
The oven-dry mass of wool fibre free from all impurities, expressed as a percentage of the mass of the sample. 
Min - The lowest value in a range of Wool Base values. 
Max - The highest value in a range of Wool Base values.

TransferType.description:
Broadcast: Send document to all members
PrivateSend: Send document to appointed members

dateFormatLastRevised.description: Date value in ISO standard UTC date format. e.g. 2024-03-21 (YYYY-MM-DD)

dateTransmissionFileCreated.description: Date value in ISO standard UTC date format. e.g. 2024-03-21 (YYYY-MM-DD)

TransmissionTypeForCatalogue.description:
2: Auction Catalogues
3: Private Catalogues
5: Auction Catalogue Updates

UpdateType.description:
A flag to indicate what type of change has been made to an item.
A: The entry is to be added
C: The entry is to be changed
D: The entry is to be deleted

saleDate.description: Date value in ISO standard UTC date format. e.g. 2024-03-21 (YYYY-MM-DD)

currency.description: The Code for the currency in which the sale was made. To obtain the current code list please use the Commonwealth Bank Currency Codes on their website

postSaleCharge.description:
This is the published rate for the charge levied by the broker to the buyer for each bale purchased and is included in the last cost of the wool.
It will not include freight if freight is listed separately in the Freight Charge field, if freight is not listed in the Freight Charge field it will include freight. 
In Australia it will always include freight as the Freight Charge field is not used.
Total 5 digits with 2 digits after the decimal point. e.g. 123.76

freightCharge.description:
If specified, this is not part of the last cost of the wool. 
If a freight charge is not included in the post Sale Charge, then the freight charge is the charge levied by the broker should the buyer request that the broker transport the wool to the nearest designated area (usually a shipping port). 
Freight Charge is not used in Australia.
Total 4 digits with 2 digits after the decimal point. e.g. 23.76

freightRebate.description: Total 4 digits with 2 digits after the decimal point. e.g. 23.76

chargePerLot.description:
Any charge made for a lot which is not covered by the Post Sale Charge or the Freight charge per Bale fields.
Total 5 digits with 2 digits after the decimal point. e.g. 123.76

isFinalCatalogue.description:
Indicates whether the related section of the catalogue transmission is expected to have more amendments transmitted or is the final transmission for that section. 
`true` = Final Catalogue. `false` = Not Final Catalogue

storageOrganisation.description:
This is the organisation store that is storing the wool. 
Note: If there is more than one organisation in a centre, then separate AWEX codes are required for each store.
It is not necessarily the same as the Releasing Organisation.

storageDescription.description: Used to provide more details on location within the Storage Organisations facility - such as street address, warehouse number etc. – to assist delivery.

paymentDueDate.description:
The date on which payment is due. Also known as Prompt Date.
Date value in ISO 8601 standard UTC format. e.g. 2024-03-21

discountRate.description: Total 4 digits with 2 digits after the decimal point. e.g. 23.76

dateStorageChargeCommences.description: Date value in ISO 8601 standard UTC date format. e.g. 2024-03-21

storageChargePerBalePerDay.description: Total 4 digits with 3 digits after the decimal point. e.g. 23.76

penaltyInterestRate.description: Total 4 digits with 2 digits after the decimal point. e.g. 23.76

lotAvailableDate.description:
The first date on which the wool is available for purchase.
Date value in ISO 8601 standard UTC date format. e.g. 2024-03-21.

postSaleChargeRebate.description:
The total (extended) amount of Post Sale Charge Rebate for the Lot. 
This value is provided where a value in the Post Sale Charge Rebate field exists (11A)
Total 5 digits with 2 digits after the decimal point. e.g. 123.76

catalogueAvailabilityDateTime.description: Date and Time value in ISO 8601 standard. e.g. 2024-03-21T19:25:04.000Z

saleStartDateTime.description: Date and Time value in ISO 8601 standard UTC datetime format. e.g. 2024-03-21T19:25:04+00:00.000Z

saleEndDateTime.description: Date and Time value in ISO 8601 standard UTC datetime format. e.g. 2024-03-21T19:25:04+00:00.000Z

reservePriceDisplayFlag.description: `true` = Available to Buyers, `false` = Not available to buyers.

tenderSaleReplyDateTime.description: Date and Time value in ISO 8601 standard UTC datetime format. e.g. 2024-03-21T19:25:04.000Z

WoolState.description:
The state of the wool itemised in the invoice.
1. Greasy
2. Dead
3. Slipe
4. Scoured
5. Carbonised
6. Wool tops
7. Wool noils
8. Carded sliver
9. Other processed wool
A. Alpaca
C. Cashmere
M. Mohair

WoolTypeGroup.description:
A code to indicate which section of the sale that lot belongs.
MFLC: Merino fleece types
MSKT: Merino fleece types
XBFS: Merino fleece types
ODDS: Merino fleece types

YieldType.description:
Yield Type indicates either the type of yield transmitted in another field or record, or the type of yield used to arrive at the value in another field.
1. RESERVED
2. RESERVED
3. Estimated.
4. Schlumberger Combed Dry (1% TFM)
5. Schlumberger Combed Dry (2% TFM)
7. Noble Combed in Oil
8. IWTO Scoured Yield at 16% Regain
9. IWTO Scoured Yield at 17% Regain
10. Japanese Clean Scoured
11. Australian Carbonising
12. IWTO Clean Wool Content, 17% Regain
13. United States Custom Clean
14. Card Sliver
15. ASTM Clean Wool Fibre Present
16. Noble Dry Combed
17. Schlumberger Combed in Oil (4.6% TFM)
18. Noble Combed Dry
19. Theoretical Card Sliver
20. ASTM Laboratory Scoured Yield
21. Conditioned at 12.00%
22. Conditioned at 13.00%
23. Conditioned at 13.50%
24: Conditioned at 13.64%
25. Conditioned at 14.00%
26. Conditioned at 14.40%
27. Conditioned at 15.00%
28. Conditioned at 16.00%
29. Conditioned at 17.00%
30. Conditioned at 18.00%
31. Conditioned at 18.25%
32. Japanese Clean Scoured at 17%
33. New Zealand Process Yield
42. IWT0 Schlumberger Oil T&N (2.0% & T.FM.)
43. IWTO Clean Wool Content, 16% Regain

Bearer.description: JWT Access Token that is added in the Authorization header of the HTTP request. Example: "Authorization: Bearer {token}". The JWT serves as a credential that proves the identity of the client to the server.
Bearer.name: Authorization

oauth2.description: Authentication for client applications by providing Client ID and Client Secret for an JWT Access Token.
